properties.title: A Series of Fantastic Writers! The Brown Handler Residents/Friends of the Library
properties.description: Friends of the San Francisco Public Library and Litquake are excited to host the writers chosen for the 2021 class of the Lisa Brown and Daniel Handler Writer’s Residency. These five writers spend a year at Friends’ studio to pursue their writing projects and share their talents with the community. The Residency, funded through Lisa Brown and Daniel Handler's generosity, is designed to nurture emerging and established writers by guaranteeing them access to free, adequate space and bringing them into direct collaboration with the Library for literary activities. This program honors the long connection between the public Library and the literary world.
properties.description_short: Friends of the San Francisco Public Library and Litquake are excited to host the writers chosen for the 2021 class of the Lisa Brown and Daniel Handler Writer’s Residency.

properties.title: Authors Shaken & Stirred
properties.description: Come down to Martuni's piano bar for regaling from Marc Huestis, Emily Nahmanson, Sumiko Saulson, and Preeti Vangani. Hosted by Jim Provenzano.
properties.description_short: Come down to Martuni's piano bar for regaling from Marc Huestis, Emily Nahmanson, Sumiko Saulson, and Preeti Vangani. Hosted by Jim Provenzano.

properties.title: In Response
properties.description: The “In Response” reading invites queer poets of color to respond to police brutality against Black, brown, and LGBTQ+ bodies through original and new poems in order to extend the conversation regarding the policing of communities of color, as well as the injustice and hate experienced by all people of color. During the coronavirus pandemic, the list of Black and brown people murdered by the police grew - Andrew Brown Jr., Adam Toledo, Ma'Khia Bryant, Daunte Wright, Rayshard Brooks, Atatianna Jefferson and more. The list of unknown names is even longer. The poets reading include Kevin Robertson, Victor Yates, and Jessica Zhou.
properties.description_short: The “In Response” reading invites queer poets of color to respond to police brutality against Black, brown, and LGBTQ+ bodies through original and new poems in order to extend the conversation regarding the policing of communities of color.
properties.address: Dog Eared Books, 900 Valencia St, CA 94110

properties.title: Maiden Magazine
properties.description: Saint Mary's College of California’s alumni-created Maiden Magazine is launching its inaugural issue! Lit Crawl is celebrating the women-run digital magazine and the MFA program they graduated from by hosting an alumni reading of prose and poetry. The event will feature the effervescent and powerful voices of Rai Ahmed-Green, Tanya Castro, Kiran Bains Sahota, Briana Swain and Maiden Magazine Editor, Caroline O’Connor Thomas. Maiden Magazine is the product of a bicoastal team of two––Brittany Wason and Caroline O’Connor Thomas––both graduates of the St. Mary’s College of California MFA with concentrations in Poetry.
properties.description_short: Saint Mary's College of California’s alumni-created Maiden Magazine is launching its inaugural issue! Lit Crawl is celebrating the women-run digital magazine and the MFA program they graduated from by hosting an alumni reading of prose and poetry.

properties.title: Manic D Press Reunion
properties.description: Manic D Press was founded in San Francisco in 1984. Their award winning books are internationally distributed and have been translated into over twelve languages. Join us for a special reunion reading, and a celebration of their return to Lit Crawl.
properties.description_short: Manic D Press was founded in San Francisco in 1984. Their award winning books are internationally distributed and have been translated into over twelve languages. Join us for a special reunion reading, and a celebration of their return to Lit Crawl.

properties.title: OWLs Who Crawl
properties.description: The Older Writer’s Lab is a group of older poets and prose authors who meet weekly to write, discuss, and share creative writing work. The Older Writer’s Lab brings together a dynamic and eclectic mix of writers and performers who are long-time residents of San Francisco and who are unabashedly unafraid to take on any subject, be it politics, sex or protest. Authors include performance poet Helen Dannenberg, community activists and organizers Anita Kline, Bill Lautner, Deborah Gerson, as well as established local writer Karen Hones.
properties.description_short: The Older Writer’s Lab is a group of older poets and prose authors who meet weekly to write, discuss, and share creative writing work.
properties.address: Adobe Books & Arts Cooperative, 3130 24th St, CA 94110

properties.title: Seventeen Syllables presents Not Your Model Minority: Artists, Rebels, and Misfits
properties.description: "As children and grandchildren of Asian immigrants, we were taught the key to success is hard work, education, and fitting in. However, as this year has made clear, meritocracy in America is a frustrating myth, and we are not all the same. We contain multitudes: our personal and professional paths go far beyond the straitjacket of the model minority. As we fight anti-Asian sentiment and work toward more inclusive AAPI representation, this Seventeen Syllables reading offers stories and poems that resist stereotypes, celebrate complexity and diversity, and expand our notion of Asian America." - Grace Loh Prasad
properties.description_short: "This Seventeen Syllables reading offers stories and poems that resist stereotypes, celebrate complexity and diversity, and expand our notion of Asian America." - Grace Loh Prasad

properties.title: The 826 Quarterly Release Reading
properties.description: 826 Valencia is a nonprofit organization dedicated to supporting under-resourced students ages six to eighteen with their creative and expository writing skills and to helping teachers inspire their students to write. 826 Valencia comprises three writing centers—a flagship location in the Mission District, a center in the Tenderloin neighborhood, and a new center on the ground floor of an affordable housing building in Mission Bay —and three satellite classrooms at nearby public schools. All of their programs are offered free of charge to make them accessible to as many students as possible. We are excited to partner with 826 Valencia for the release of The 826 Quarterly, Volume 29, an anthology of the most dynamic writing from across their programs. Join these young authors, foreword writer Kevin Dublin, and cover designer Yétúndé Olagbaju to celebrate this exciting new publication showcasing youth voices.
properties.description_short: 826 Valencia is a nonprofit dedicated to supporting under-resourced students ages six to eighteen with their writing skills. Join these young authors to celebrate the release of The 826 Quarterly, Volume 29, an anthology of the most dynamic writing from across their programs.
properties.address: 826 Valencia Pirate Supply Store, 826 Valencia St, CA 94110

properties.title: Voices from Amble Press: A New Queer Publisher
properties.description: Amble Press is a new LGBTQ press with a focus on publishing both emerging and established queer writers. Alongside Litquake, they will present their first crop of writers. Their works are diverse in form, style, and content, encompassing crime fiction, memoir, short form fiction, and literary fiction, from writers who are white, Latinx and Black, male and female, boomer and millennial.
properties.description_short: Amble Press is a new LGBTQ press with a focus on publishing both emerging and established queer writers. Alongside Litquake, they will present their first crop of writers. Their works are diverse in form, style, and content.

properties.title: A Literary Relay Race Castro Writers Cooperative
properties.description: Watch as a story zanily evolves when writers each pen short sections of a tale in their own unique styles, ending in mid-sentence to hand off to another and continue until the adventure is completed.
properties.description_short: Watch as a story zanily evolves when writers each pen short sections of a tale in their own unique styles, ending in mid-sentence to hand off to another and continue until the adventure is completed.

properties.title: Cleavage Collective
properties.description: Cleavage Collective engages you with their poetic momentum, driven by and unique to the liminal spaces and intersectional identities they all occupy. Cleavage will entice you with sex, death, drugs, southern hometowns, and music by alternating readers piece by piece. They juxtapose each writers’ work to the next; thereby, producing a rapid-fire reading that is sure to entertain.
properties.description_short: Cleavage Collective engages you with their poetic momentum, driven by and unique to the liminal spaces and intersectional identities they all occupy. Cleavage will entice you with sex, death, drugs, southern hometowns, and music by alternating readers piece by piece.

properties.title: Essential Truths: The Bay Area in Color
properties.description: Essential Truths: The Bay Area in Color, edited by Shizue Seigel, is a robust and timely anthology that features 130 BIPOC writers, poets and artists reflecting on Bay Area realities, during times of unprecedented uncertainty. This year, join Write Now! SF Bay's Shizue Seigel and five diverse poets as they find meaning in everyday moments that are too often overlooked.
properties.description_short: Essential Truths: The Bay Area in Color is a timely anthology that features 130 BIPOC writers, poets and artists reflecting on Bay Area realities, during times of unprecedented uncertainty. Join Shizue Seigel and five diverse poets as they find meaning in everyday moments.

properties.title: Fourteen Hills
properties.description: Since its inception in 1994, Fourteen Hills: The SFSU Review has contributed to a vibrant literary tradition on the West Coast centered in the San Francisco Bay Area. Its commitment to presenting a diversity of experimental and progressive work by emerging and cross-genre writers, as well as by award-winning and established authors, has earned it a reputation for literary excellence. Staffed exclusively by graduate students in the creative writing program at San Francisco State University with the oversight of faculty advisor Carolina De Robertis, Fourteen Hills publishes original poetry, fiction, literary nonfiction, and cross-genre work created by writers in the US and abroad. It also welcomes and prints representative contributions from visual artists. The staff strive to publish the most compelling literature, and being independent means its aesthetic is dynamic and fluid, ever changing to meet the needs of the culture and the historical moment as the staff perceive them. Join this year's editors in celebration of the latest issue.
properties.description_short: Since its inception in 1994, Fourteen Hills: The SFSU Review has contributed to a vibrant literary tradition on the West Coast centered in the San Francisco Bay Area. Join this year's editors in celebration of the latest issue.
properties.address: Dog Eared Books, 900 Valencia St, CA 94110

properties.title: Left Margin Lit Boot Camp
properties.description: Left Margin Lit Boot Camp is a friendly group of writers that work in community at the Left Margin Lit offices in Berkeley, CA. Left Margin Lit began the boot camp five years ago to give writers a quiet, supportive time and space to write harder and better and more. Several writers have been attending boot camp since the beginning. Others have cycled in and out over the years and last year, the year of zoom, many maintained connection through writing groups and virtual write-ins. It's grown into a cohesive, supportive community that holds regular readings to celebrate the work that is generated during those long, quiet hours together. Left Margin Lit Boot Camp is comprised of poets and playwrights, novelists, academics and memoirists alike.
properties.description_short: Left Margin Lit Boot Camp is a friendly group of writers that work in community at the Left Margin Lit offices in Berkeley, CA. Left Margin Lit began the boot camp five years ago to give writers a quiet, supportive time and space to write harder and better and more.
properties.address: Mission: Comics & Art, 2250 Mission St, CA 94110

properties.title: The Racket Lit Crawl Edition: CRISIS
properties.description: After a year spent communicating across the void of the internet, it feels as if the rifts between us as individuals, as states, as countries has only widened. The planet gets hotter, the world continues to war, the gap between the haves and have nots only grows greater. With the world drastically changed, what does it mean to continue to live in a state of CRISIS?
properties.description_short: After a year spent communicating across the void of the internet, it feels as if the rifts between us as individuals, as states, as countries has only widened. With the world drastically changed, what does it mean to continue to live in a state of CRISIS?
properties.address: Adobe Books & Arts Cooperative, 3130 24th St, CA 94110

properties.title: ¿Dónde Esta Mi Gente?
properties.description: ¿Dónde Esta Mi Gente? is excited to be doing its first in person show since the pandemic during the legendary Lit Crawl, and to bring you dynamic literary performances by some of the best Latin-American writers in the Bay Area! ¿Dónde Esta Mi Gente? was created by Baruch Porras Hernandez in 2014 and has been putting together stellar literary shows all over San Francisco ever since, as well as presenting regular shows virtually during the Pandemic. This show is hosted by Baruch Porras Hernandez, and features Jaime Cortez, Thea Matthews, and Persia!¡No se lo pierdan!
properties.description_short: ¿Dónde Esta Mi Gente? is excited to be doing its first in person show since the pandemic during the legendary Lit Crawl, and to bring you dynamic literary performances by some of the best Latin-American writers in the Bay Area! This show is hosted by Baruch Porras Hernandez.

properties.title: Bazaar Writers Salon
properties.description: Bazaar Writers Salon is a San Francisco reading series founded in 2012 by Peter Kline. The mission of Bazaar Writers Salon is to showcase the very best writing (poetry, fiction, and nonfiction) of the Bay Area and beyond, and to bring together some of the disparate Bay Area writing communities in a positive environment where everyone is welcome. This reading will feature Derrick Austin, Micah Ballard, Peter Bullen, Rita Bullwinkel, and Kathleen Winter.
properties.description_short: Bazaar Writers Salon is a San Francisco reading series founded in 2012 by Peter Kline. The mission of Bazaar Writers Salon is to showcase the very best writing of the Bay Area and beyond, and to bring together Bay Area writing communities in a positive environment.

properties.title: Organ Music: Dispatches From Our Insides
properties.description: Bodies gurgle, rumble, and leak. They channel ecstasies and metabolize histories. And who knows what’s going on inside those belly buttons. Join our workshop group of writers from The Ruby as they read from a wide variety of genres and styles, all related to the glorious, brilliant, messy, and strange human body. Novel about a traveling sideshow? Personal essay about demonic possession? The erotics of a blade gliding up a shin bone, skimming over a crotch? Get ready for it all…including a series of musical organ interludes! With Marya Brennan, Sarah Rose Cadorette, Kathryn Jaller, Kathleen J. Woods, and B. Lynn Woolman.
properties.description_short: Bodies gurgle, rumble, and leak. They channel ecstasies and metabolize histories. And who knows what’s going on inside those belly buttons. Join our workshop group of writers from The Ruby as they read from a wide variety of genres and styles, all related to the glorious, brilliant, messy, and strange human body.

properties.title: Red Light Lit
properties.description: Red Light Lit is devoted to writers who explore love, relationships, sexuality, identity, and gender. Since their founding in 2013, they have published 10 literary journals and produced over 100 live shows (including in Austin, Chicago, Los Angeles, Portland, San Francisco, and Seattle). In 2019, Red Light Lit published the poetry anthology Love Is the Drug & Other Dark Poems; and in 2020, it published Unearth [The Flowers] by Thea Matthews, its first single-author poetry collection.
properties.description_short: Red Light Lit is devoted to writers who explore love, relationships, sexuality, identity, and gender. Since their founding in 2013, they have published 10 literary journals and produced over 100 live shows.

properties.title: ZYZZYVA Fall All-Stars
properties.description: Zyzzyva presents readings from past and recent contributors to the journal of arts and letters founded in San Francisco in 1985. Featuring Jonathan Escoffery, Gabriela Garcia, Vanessa Hua, D.A. Powell, and Margaret Wilkerson Sexton. ZYZZYVA was founded in 1985 in San Francisco with the goal of publishing a superb literary journal shining a spotlight on West Coast poets, writers, and artists from a wide range of backgrounds, many of whom were otherwise overlooked by established publications, and providing them with a much needed platform. Since then, the journal has evolved into a nationally distributed, widely acclaimed publication showcasing contributors from across the country and around the world. In 2020, the journal marked 35 years of continuous publishing, celebrating more than three decades of enriching contemporary literature and supporting literary communities in the Bay Area and beyond.
properties.description_short: Zyzzyva presents readings from past and recent contributors to the journal of arts and letters founded in San Francisco in 1985. Featuring Jonathan Escoffery, Gabriela Garcia, Vanessa Hua, D.A. Powell, and Margaret Wilkerson Sexton.
properties.address: Dog Eared Books, 900 Valencia St, CA 94110

properties.title: The Fabulist presents: Here is the Future You Requested
properties.description: Join The Fabulist’s eclectic and wildly talented lineup of Bay Area writers for an evening of science fiction, fantasy and fantastical prose that explore utopian and dystopian tomorrows, as seen from the depths of our own pandemic-era techno-consumerist vortex.
properties.description_short: Join The Fabulist’s eclectic and wildly talented lineup of Bay Area writers for an evening of science fiction, fantasy and fantastical prose that explore utopian and dystopian tomorrows, as seen from the depths of our own pandemic-era techno-consumerist vortex.

properties.title: Lit Camp presents The Unreliable Narrator - Stories of Deception, Cluelessness and All-Out Lying
properties.description: Join Lit Camp as they present stories of deception, cluelessness and all-out lying. Lit Camp is a SF-based, nonprofit, juried writers conference held every year at Esalen in Big Sur, CA. Many of our alumni have gone on to publish best-selling books. For Lit Crawl 2021, Lit Camp is choosing one talented writer from of their six conferences to read a short piece written especially for the Crawl on the topic of Unreliable Narrator.
properties.description_short: Join Lit Camp as they present stories of deception, cluelessness and all-out lying. For Lit Crawl 2021, Lit Camp is choosing one talented writer from each of their six conferences to read a short piece written especially for the Crawl on the topic of Unreliable Narrator.
properties.address: Mission: Comics & Art, 2250 Mission St, CA 94110

properties.title: Noir at The Bar with the Mystery Writers of America
properties.description: Noir at the Bar is just what it sounds like—a chance for writers to read their works aloud at bars before an audience of readers, writers, and, erm, drinkers. It's a great way to introduce authors who might have slipped under the radar to a crowd of people who love crime fiction.
properties.description_short: Noir at the Bar is just what it sounds like—a chance for writers to read their works aloud at bars before an audience of readers, writers, and, erm, drinkers. It's a great way to introduce authors who might have slipped under the radar to a crowd of people who love crime fiction.
